Reviews.Title: “Consistently pleasant accomodations”
Reviews.Author: austinboy
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, courteous and very pleasant hotel in Rome. It is not walking distance from the historical center, but just a few blocks from Piazza Euclide and an easy subway ride or taxi ride to central Rome. The quality of the hotel, the size of the rooms, the politeness of the staff easily makes up for it. The Suites costs about what you would pay for a room in central Rome and are well worth it. The restaurant provides a fair breakfast. I would not recommend it for lunch or dinner as there are far better eating establishments an easy walking distance. By the way, for families, the suites have a living room area with couches that open into beds. Great for a family of four.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest commercial practices”
Reviews.Author: marieLePecq
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room for 2 nights on the hotel's website. It was a pre-paid promotional offer. When we arrived the room was not available (we had given our time of arrival). We were relocated in a hotel of inferior level and rates (although also 4 star) where we had to go by our own means. We had chosen this hotel specifically to be close to our family and found this to be a great inconvenience. Moreover we did not get what we paid for as the price of the rooms of the Grand Hotel Fleming (where they sent us) is about half that of the Hotel degli Aranci. If you book this hotel you will be taking the risk of being sent even further away from the centre, at your own expense, and in hotels of lesser quality.

Reviews.Title: “bellisimo!”
Reviews.Author: Brooke G
Reviews.Content: This is Rome's best kept secret, a place far from the crowd, elite, secure and comfortable. Lorenzo, the maitre chef, was at the helm of the restaurant the whole time and made sure the meals form breakfast to dinner were exceptional. The rooms are imaculate.The staff was courteous and became friends very quickly...it helps if you know Italian or are making a sincere effort to learn it. Bella Degli Aranci, te amo.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: greece_traveler_9
Reviews.Content: We had a triple room and it was gorgeous! Big hallway with double wardrobe, big double bedroom, a separarte lounge area with 2 sofas (can each be made into spare beds), big bathroom with a jacuzzi bath and a huge tarrace with garden furniture. The decor and cleanliness was exceptional. The hotel staff is very friendly, they helped with parking and every little question we had they answered stright away. The hotel run a shuttle bus to and from the city centre, so don't worry if you are not used to the trains and metro system. To us breakfast is important and they even delivered on that. Scrambled eggs and cooked ham, a variety of cold meats and cheese, cereal, cakes, bread, jam etc. There is a coffee machine, but the waiter will make you a proper espresso or cappuccino if you ask.

Reviews.Title: “For those not looking to stay in a fancy place on the high street”
Reviews.Author: matowi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is for those who do not mind not living in the very center of the city, where the night life explodes and all the attractions are within 5 minutes' walk. The 'Degli Aranci' sits in a posh, quiet, residential area (worth noting that in the same street there are at least 4 embassies, including Switzerland). So you'll feel at home, if you are willing to live a little bit aside from the crowds, you don't mind walking or using public transportation (by the way in this regard the 'Degli Aranci' is very well located: several different bus lines and one of the main tramway lines are within couple of minutes' walk, and they take you to all major attractions of Rome or to Termini station if you prefer). Now about the main point: this is a VERY BASIC place to stay. Really, it boggles my mind, how on Earth it scored 4 stars. The rooms (we rented 2...) are small, and most of furniture and bathroom fittings saw better times and probably haven't been changed in the past 5 or 10 years. It all feels worn (however, the beds are still sufficiently comfortable). My most dramatic complaint is with the breakfast. I haven't experienced such bad selection ever. The choice is limited to some sweet pastry (not tasty, very fat and veeeeeeery sweet), some mediocre yoghurts, appalling fruit salad (basically it's nothing but chopped pineapple and chopped peach - both straight out of a can), some wheat buns, bad cheese, bad salami and very bad ham. Even to get a proper espresso you need to ask the waiters, because the available machine produces a liquid not worthy of being called coffee. Enough of the bad. For the good I can say two things: rooms and the whole place are very clean (despite the "worn feeling"), and staff are super friendly and helpful. Especially at the front desk. If you consciously choose this place as your selected staying option, weigh the cons and pros. It's equally easy to like this place and to hate it.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: isabelbarbedo
Reviews.Content: very clean and staff very nice. our room had a balcony and it was spacious. The breakfast was very basic so don't expect too much of it. the location it's not the best. It's in a quiet area but public transports are complicated. it's not near the metro line, for that you have to catch a train for one stop and then you are on metro line A. The bus system is complicated but it's the best way to get to the hotel. right outside the hotel you have bus 217 that takes you to the main station Termini and 10 minutes walking you have tram19 that takes you to the vatican city. but all lines finish at midnight, after that you have night buses or taxis. We opt for the taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with decent location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: elmanelman
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days there with my partner and 3 other couples. Location of hotel is a bit away from the main city-sights, but you can take 15 min bus right next to the hotel to Termini station from where you can walk to almost all of famous places. Hotel is located in quite and nice place. Rooms are clean and nice but some of them may be quite small. One of our couples had to change their room due to its size. There are four separate room in the yard of the hotel on the ground level those rooms may be a bit lower standard compared to the main building rooms. Internet price is reasonable but may be slow in some rooms. Breakfast is good but not great. Staff is great and helpful. Kept our luggage after check out in very friendly manner.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel with very helpful staff, great breakfast - only slight problem our room was in basement.”
Reviews.Author: goodyme
Reviews.Content: A very clean, elegant hotel which was exactly as advertised. We walked north to Euclide Train Station and got the train into Rome each day. It arrives at Piazza Popolo near the Spanish Steps and you can get on the metro from there and visit all parts of downtown Rome. Hilly area - if you are not fit, it may be a bit of a tiring time getting into Rome. Staff were GREAT. Always helpful and friendly. Breakfast each day was just right and as much as you wished.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ,clean hotel in a beautiful residential area”
Reviews.Author: ciprianjitaru_jitaru
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small and intim. Rooms are clean , spacious and with style. Staff is ok and they help you to find out your ways in Rome. The hotel is located in Pariolli district which is a select residential area . Is not very close to the centre of Rome , but you can use either bus 217 to reach Termini Central Station Rome or metro line to Euclide station which is 800 meters form the hotel . Termini station can be reached from airport directly by train 12 euro (30 minutes ) or by shuttle bus in front of terminal T3 8 euros(1 hour) Be aware that you need at least 3 days to cover at least the most important monuments of Rome. Only negative commentary is related to the dog excrements . The whole Pariolli district is full of them so watch your steps.

Reviews.Title: “Not for tourists or travellers looking to experience Rome”
Reviews.Author: LPMac
Reviews.Content: Terrific disappointment! The hotel itself was fair/fine...not the worst, far from the best. But you dont go to Rome for a hotel, in fact, you go to see the sights, which were quite far away and inconvenient. The front desk staff on THREE occasions gave us wrong information about the bus lines and hours of operation. Cabs back and forth are a waste of time and money. Also the hotel tried to get us to pay an extra 15 euros for a cab ride to the airport, but don't let them! The service was uninspired and borderline unpleasant. A terrible hotel for tourists or anyone wanting any kind of a nightlife. We did manage, however, to have a lovely time in Rome in spite of this hotel and its negligence. If you want upscale but centralized, stay somewhere near the top of the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zarchan
Reviews.Content: The 3 of us stayed for 5 days in July. The rooms well clean, well maintained and quiet. The location of the hotel was about 8 minues from borghese park and a couple minutes away from the bus stops. The breakfast was good although expect lighter foods. Such as breads, cheese, meat, fruit coffee, etc.. And looking around Italy food proportions definately play a part ina higher percentage of Americans being overweight. So a light breakfast is probably a good thing. The staff was knowledgable and accommodating. However, we did have a couple of issues, and not so much a problem as an irritant. When we put up the "Do Not Disturb" signs the maid came in irregardless and cleaned our room while we were out. I suppose we really can't blame her for cleaning our rooms... Secondly, 2 of the Front desk people were excellent the 3rd however not so much. I came back after dinner and was asking him how best to travel to the Vatican from the hotel he explained the best course quite well. However, as I was leaving he commented to the bell hop in italian in frustration. He could of at least waited until I was out of ear shot.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel degli Aranci”
Reviews.Author: SaraRH
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. I do advice to stay in it.

Reviews.Title: “Uninspired staff”
Reviews.Author: MVB/JK
Reviews.Content: When in Rome, a nice place to stay indeed. Very clean and fresh decorated Italian style rooms, including a spacious bathroom. Shabby chique breakfast room where you can order as many cappuccino's as you want. Pity though, that the service is quite uninspired and unsincere! Catch your bus to the historic city center at Piazza Santiago di Cile (a two minute walk from the hotel). And when in the eternal city, do rent a bike to ride along the Via Appia Antica and have a picknick at the Caracalla park. Unforgettable! MvB, The Hague

Reviews.Title: “A happy 40th Birthday”
Reviews.Author: JGreenfield
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome on 6 Oct 2006 as a treat for my husband's 40th birthday, staying at the Degli Aranci. On arrival the staff were efficient and extremely helpful. The room was very pleasant, if a little on the small side, but the bathroom was very good. Although it is a little distance from the city centre, it has good access via public transport or the taxis were very reasonable. The upside of the location is that it was very peaceful, which was not something that could be said for the rest of the city!! We had a great time in Rome and the weather for the time of year was fantastic, the Colosseum and the Forum being my favourite places to visit. We were approached by tour guides to join their groups at both the Vatican and the Colosseum and for a few extra Euros we jumped some very long queues and the guides were very knowledgable. I would recommend both the City and the Hotel for a short break or special treat.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: CynthiaLee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Aranci for three days while in Rome. This hotel is located in Parioli near Villa Borghese. It is a beautiful hotel run by lovely, polite people eager to help you. Marco was exceptionally kind and helpful. Always greeted you with a smile as did everyone. The gentleman who carried our luggage up to our rooms was also very kind and sweet. The rooms were meticulously clean and offered everything you might need. The corner rooms are particularly nice and spacious. My room #130 had three large vertical windows. One in the bathroom and two in the room itself with french style doors opening to the large patio. Tile floors and beautifully hung sheers and drapes made this room comfortable and inviting. While this hotel is slightly out of the way it is well worth it and the taxi to the city center is a learning experience as you become familiar with landmarks along the way. I highly recommend this hotel for those who want to get away from the hustle and bustle after a day in Rome and have a lovely room waiting for you.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: dutchvoyager
Reviews.Content: i have been for three days in rome and stayed at the hotel degli aranci. after reading the reviews here i have to agree that this place is in a relaxing spot of the city. If you want a nice and quiet place this is the hotel! dont expect to much of the breakfast because it is marginized to some bread, cheese, bacon, eggs and milk. the cappucino was not that great for italian standards. the room on itself meets the requirements and the staff is very helpfull and professional. but if you like to go out on a evening and dont want to lose time on your evenings it is better to book a hotel in the centre of rome. mostly i would prefer via barbini if i would stay in rome for the next time.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Parioli”
Reviews.Author: bbradyesq
Reviews.Content: My lovely wife and two daughters, ages 24 and 21, and I loved the Hotel Degli Aranci and it's very professional and friendly staff. We stayed there for 4 lovely nights in mid-August 2005. The recently renovated rooms are far superior to the photos on the website, the breakfast delicious and plentiful, the public areas lovely and computer room and facilities first rate. We had a spectacular terrace with a view of the City on one side, the Tiber to the north and the Swiss embassy and gorgeous mountains to the east. It was so quiet, one evening we opened the windows to both bedrooms and the door to the terrace and slept soundly while breathing in cool, fresh night air. The staff was energetic, willing to please and very kind and accommodating, and the short trip to the Spanish steps by cab (7-10 Euros)or bus well worth the solitude and grace of this beautiful hotel. At 150 Euros per night, we felt very fortunate to have found this gem in Parioli. We would stay here again in an instant! William Brady, Denver, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Quiet welcoming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Not part of an impersonal giant hotel chain but a quiet friendly hotel in a charming area away from the noise and traffic of the centre, yet only a 15 min bus journey away from Termini. (Or do as we did and walk through the Villa Borghese Park to the Spanish Steps, approx. 40 mins but loads to see) Staff were all so friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean, tidy and well decorated. If it's not on display at breakfast just ask and you will get, no problems. There is a wonderful restaurant down the hill to the main road and to the left where you will be surrounded by locals enjoying a great meal....always a sign of a good restaurant. Service is great. Also a superb wine shop 5 mins away with a huge choice of wine to buy. If you don't want to stay in the noisy centre of the town then I would recommend this hotel highly. We will be back.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Degli Aranci
HotelInfo.Address: Via Barnaba Oriani, 11, 00197 Rome, Italy
